item.title: [Joule] Stabilizing α-FAPbI3 perovskite via centered formamidinium cation immobilization
item.description: Pyrene at perovskite grain boundaries immobilizes formamidinium cations, stabilizing the PbI6 cage and rigidifying α-FAPbI3. Rigid α-FAPbI3 exhibited a uniform spatioenergetic landscape, reduced electron-phonon coupling, facilitated efficient charge transport, and suppressed perovskite degradation. Pyrene-incorporated α-FAPbI3 retained its photoactive phase with over 25% power conversion efficiency and operational stability exceeding 3,400 h.
item.author: Joule

item.title: [RSC - Energy En] Blocking multifaceted degradation pathways via fluorinated hydrogen-bond armor for stable perovskite solar cells
item.description:
Energy Environ. Sci., 2026, Advance Article
DOI: 10.1039/D5EE04336K, Paper
Yilin Gao, Yuehui Li, Guozhen Liu, Naitian Zhang, Siao Li, Zhiyong Wang, Zheng Lv, Yinjuan Zhang, Lin Yang, Jie Zhang, Linghui Zhang, Wenrui Li, Wenming Tian, Wenzhe Li, Zhehan Ying, Jijun Qiu, Yantao Shi
The fluorinated hydrogen-bond armor strategy was proposed to comprehensively protect formamidinium cations from deprotonation. The device achieved high efficiency of 26.51% and exceptional durability under ISOS-L-2 and ISOS-D-2 protocols.
To cite this article before page numbers are assigned, use the DOI form of citation above.
